citeulike_paper.title: Surveying the identification of communities
citeulike_paper.abstract: Nowadays, many networks of interest include a variety of social and technological networks, which are naturally divided into communities. The identification of these community structures has considerably attracted the attention of researchers in recent years. Thus, this paper reviews the main algorithms for finding communities and locating meaningful structures. The survey starts from graph theory and includes the latest algorithms for detecting web communities. The existence of communities that can overlap is also taken into account, as well as the main commonly used software tools for depicting communities.

source.title: Int. J. Web Based Communities, Vol. 4, No. 3. (July 2008), pp. 334-347, doi:10.1504/IJWBC.2008.019193ￂﾠ Key: citeulike:11532060
